column1: 295$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/13/2010 10:01:45 PM$Reviewer: punk, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$Worse experience of my life!!! Unable to function.. Horrible I have never had a problem with effexor and this venlafaxine has totally messed me up.

637$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/21/2011 5:14:07 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$1$3$This medication works but the side effects for me at least are extreme sweating and weight gain.  I'm miserable.  I sweat profusely with just the littlest activity.  Head sweats are terrible.  I need to stop this medication because my legs and ankles are all just retaining water like mad but do I have to check myself into a hospital to get through the withdrawal symptoms?  I've tried cutting down on the dosage but I get the spins and feel like I'm gonna throw up.  I'm not sure what to do but I'm not happy being on this.  I've never gained so much weight in my life.  I now weigh 185 and I haven't weighed this much since I gave birth to my daughter 18 years ago.  
797$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$9/22/2009 11:44:55 AM$Reviewer: tony, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$5$i am now just starting at 7mmg per day ..my dr.wants me to go to 150mg per say after a week..i would like advice from anyone that has done this and there results..i fell i am gong to call my dr.and just askif i can stay on the 75mg for a month to see if it is at all the drug for me...even if i get a little releaf then i would feel better about going up to the 150mg.....any comments would be appreciated.....ciao
1005$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/4/2007 9:19:12 PM$Reviewer: Afraid to Go Back, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I started using Effexor XR 150 mg. daily when I started menopause.  I have had mood swings and depression since I was 16 years old. I have always experienced extreme irritability and anger. This drug gave me back my life and helped me become the mother and wife that I had always tried to be. I now get to enjoy the holidays  without freaking out and ruining it for everyone. It also helps my ADHD!  I am so much happier now. The only problem that i have experience is that when I miss a dose
column3: vivid dreams all night. I always know when I miss a dose because of that. I have been on it for 5 years
column4: and I'm afraid to quit for fear that my life will return to what it was like before. I have also read all of the horror stories of people trying to quit

column1:
1132$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/23/2017 8:46:00 AM$Reviewer: judy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$5$5$
1989$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/24/2010 10:25:55 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I've been on Effexor XR Caps for 8 years.

I went from Wellbutrin that stopped working to this one. It has worked well for these years. REading any reviews can scare a person about any drug.  I take mine first thing in the morning. I was warned not to take it later than noon because of possible insomnia.  My diagnosis ranges from depression to ""change of life"" issues

I've been very fortunate to be able to obtain this medication and follow the dosing exactly 75 mg for me.  I do my very best to keep track of dosage and refill before I run out. For someone who uses it faithfully
column2: it works....side effects? I haven't really had any. "

column1: 2154$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$4/3/2010 3:03:00 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $4$3$4$"My youngest child went to college. I got married. Became caregiver for parents. Retired. All things between 1995 and 2003.
I also began menopause during that time. Took hormones
column2: but could not tolerate them. Since taking Effexor I am more able to handle the stresses of life. It keeps me level. Much more calmer to handle situation with calmness  "

column1: 2766$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/28/2009 5:22:48 PM$Reviewer: jcfsusmc
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$4$5$"Effexor has saved my life and relationships.  After going through a series of therapies for major depression
column3: it was discovered that I had a major case of ADHD with anxiety and panic cohorts (at the age of 48!).  This diagnosis explained everything that was me.  I was referred to a PA (believe it or not!) who worked with Psych MD's and started me on Effexor.  It was almost an instant relief of my anxiety.  After two months
column4: I was at 150mg per day.  Now
column5: to get off ritalin without driving everyone mad.  Without ritalin
column6: I am now on 300 mg per day
column7: with 300 mg of Wellbutrin to boot!  Yes
column9: but it's disconcerting that most of the reviews are negative.

column1: First
column2: I was on several drugs for a while that didn't really work.  I agree that Effexor shouldn't be a first line of defense.  But if it works
column3: why worry about the withdrawals?  I don't ever want to stop taking Effexor.  My wife and kids can approach me 24/7 even with bad news.  I have no stress except eustress.  I can keep my cool

column1: One other thing - why is Effexor not advertised (by the doctors) more for treatment of moderate to severe AD/HD?
I have nothing but high praise for Effexor.  It saved my marriage

column1: 3087$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/27/2009 2:54:44 PM$Reviewer: stamperdad
column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$4$5$"I have adult ADHD with an emphasis on symptoms such as low frustration intolerance
column4: hyperactivity. These contributed to anger outbursts and saying stupid remarks for no reason.

column1: I have been on it for about four months presently at 150 mg. The best thing I ever did. Tried Ritalin at first. It was totally unsatisfactory and inconvenient.
So far main side effect has been tiredness
column2: but it's going away now. Also some nausea in first month

column1: 3101$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$1/22/2009 9:47:00 PM$Reviewer: lea2529
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$5$I have been on Effexor XR for a total of 3 years. I was on it for a year before I had my son and have been on it for 2 years after he was born. I have ADHD with anxiety and depression. I started out at 75mg and am now at 225mg. This has been the only medication that has worked for all of my symptoms. I couldn't believe how well it worked in the beginning. My concentration was amazing. I didn't even know that it was possible to feel like that. I had tried Zoloft
column4: Aderall and many others that I don't even remember. I feel like I've tried everything. I do have to say that there are terrible withdrawal symptoms when you go off of it. I went off of it cold turkey off of 150mg when I was trying to get pregnant. Now that I have been on it for 2 years straight I am scared of going through the withdrawal again but I have started noticing a resistance to it.

column1: 3703$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/28/2008 10:59:15 PM$Reviewer:  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$2$2$5$"I tried this instead of Dexedrine for ADD (no hyperactivity) last summer
column2: and it made me sleepy (NOT a good sign of an ANTI-depressant!) and my jaw would ""shiver"".  I went back to Dexedrine after 2 months of Effexor."

column1: 4308$Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/27/2007 1:53:45 AM$Reviewer: Steakumm
column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Effexor with adderal has changed my life . I am in sales and my production has increased 200%. I take the effexor 150mg in the morning and the adderal around noon. These two drugs have been life changing and given me so much more patience with clients and family.
